articles.title: Bluffs man wanted in federal case arrested after pursuit
articles.description: The wanted man was booked into the Pottawattamie County Jail on suspicion of eluding arrest, reckless driving and having no insurance.

articles.author: By Mike Brownlee World-Herald News Service
articles.title: Horses of Honor statue honors slain Pottawattamie County sheriff's deputy
articles.description: More than 200 people gathered outside the Squirrel Cage Jail on Saturday to honor the late Pottawattamie County Sheriff’s Deputy Mark Burbridge with a public art exhibit.

articles.description: The woman was booked into the Pottawattamie County Jail on suspicion of theft and eluding police, and on an outstanding warrant, authorities said.

articles.author: By Tim Johnson / World-Herald News Service
articles.title: Iowa Western professor donates 800 books to Pottawattamie County Jail
articles.description: Nicole Juranek, a communications professor at Iowa Western Community College, donated 800 books to the jail this week. That makes her third annual donation a record, more than doubling the 300 she gave during the first two years.

articles.author: By Kevin Cole / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Denver man who's charged with robbery in federal arrest warrant is captured in Council Bluffs after police pursuit
articles.description: Blake A. Newton, 23, was booked into the Pottawattamie County Jail as a fugitive from justice. He was captured in a parking lot, according to a statement from the Council Bluffs Police Department.

articles.author: By Jay Withrow World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Iowan facing attempted murder charge released from Omaha hospital
articles.description: After his release, Clifton Wade was booked into the Douglas County Jail as a fugitive from justice, Bluffs police said.

articles.title: Pottawattamie board moves to expand applicant pool for deputies
articles.description: The Pottawattamie County Sheriff’s Office is looking to expand its applicant pool for deputies.

articles.title: Bluffs,an accused of trying to run over officer is jailed
articles.description: Jamie Kennedy, 27, was transferred to the Pottawattamie County Jail on Sept. 12 in connection to a June 2 incident where he allegedly tried to run over an officer in an attempt to escape authorities, according to court records.

articles.title: After fatal escape, Pottawattamie County Jail adds full-body scanner to protect staff, inmates
articles.description: Pottawattamie County Sheriff Jeff Danker said the jail’s new security body scanner will help prevent prisoners smuggling contraband in the future — and that such a device could have prevented tragedy a year ago.

articles.description: Officials say 32-year-old Ivan Antonio Cervantes was sentenced Wednesday to 18 additional months in prison and two years of supervised release.

articles.author: By Mike Brownlee World-Herald News Service
articles.title: Horses of Honor statue pays tribute to slain Pottawattamie County sheriff's deputy
articles.description: The statue of a horse with no rider, one of the Horses of Honor memorials, was painted with scenes of motorcycles, all-terrain vehicles, a badge, a “dream” car garage and other vignettes that represented Deputy Mark Burbridge’s life and interests.

articles.description: Eric Scott, 37, escaped Wednesday while being driven from the Nebraska State Penitentiary by a Dodge County deputy.

articles.description: The Council Bluffs police officer who shot an Omaha man earlier this month was justified in his use of force because he thought it was necessary to defend himself and others, the Pottawattamie County attorney said Friday.

articles.author: By Christopher Burbach World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Douglas County Jail officers 'worn down' by mandatory overtime, union says
articles.description: Mandatory overtime shifts are placing further stress on corrections officers at the Douglas County Jail — a staff that already is worn thin by a shortage of officers and an unusually high inmate population, union leaders say.

articles.description: At issue is whether Robert Reynolds deliberately shot and killed a woman or whether he had perceived her, while having a drunken hallucination, as being possessed by a demon and posing a threat.

articles.description: Deputy Mark Burbridge was shot dead by an inmate trying to escape in Council Bluffs, Iowa, in May 2017. He is survived by children Kelsey, 23, Kaleb, 15, and Karley 14, and his wife Jessica.

articles.description: Dog owners from across the country boarded their dogs at Young Gunz Kennel so they could be trained to be hunting dogs.

articles.author: By Paul Hammel World-Herald Bureau
articles.title: Turnover at Nebraska prisons increases to 34 percent, despite state's efforts
articles.description: Turnover for such workers rose to the highest in recent memory, 34 percent, up from 31 percent in 2016. Overtime expenses are also on pace to eclipse the $9.3 million spent during the 2016-17 fiscal year.
